conclusion: Need to consider forces acting on objects A and B when they move through the air and are placed down.
Air resistance affects objects moving through the air.
Objects A and B are moving through the air and are placed down at the location of objects C, D, E, F.
Objects A and B will experience gravity and air resistance as they fall.
Objects A and B will fall towards the center of the room due to gravity.
Air resistance will slow down the fall of objects A and B.
Objects C, D, E, and F will remain stationary in their current positions.
Final positions: Objects A and B fall towards the center; Objects C, D, E, and F remain stationary.
